text: If a:b = 5:9 and b:c = 4:7, find a:b:c.

fastMethod.title: LCM method for merging ratios
fastMethod.justificationMd:
To merge a:b and b:c, make 'b' common.
LCM of 9 and 4 is 36.
Convert a:b = 5:9 to (5*4):(9*4) = 20:36.
Convert b:c = 4:7 to (4*9):(7*9) = 36:63.
So, a:b:c = 20:36:63.
fastMethod.pitfallMd: Forgetting to scale all parts of the ratio.

fastMethod.title: Fractional Rate & Time Conversion
fastMethod.pitfallMd: Using the percentage directly without converting to a fraction, or using months directly instead of years.

text: On a sum of ₹10000, what is the compound interest for 2 years at 10% per annum, compounded annually?

fastMethod.title: Successive Percentage Change
fastMethod.justificationMd:
For two years at 10%, the effective rate is (10 + 10 + (10*10)/100)% = 21%.
CI = 21% of 10000 = ₹2100.
fastMethod.pitfallMd: Calculating Simple Interest (20%) or miscalculating the final amount instead of just the interest.

text: A man's salary is decreased by 50%. By what percent should his new salary be increased to restore his original salary?

fastMethod.title: Fractional Change Logic
fastMethod.justificationMd:
A 50% decrease means the salary becomes 1/2 of the original.
To restore it, you need to add another 1/2, which is 100% of the *new* salary.
fastMethod.pitfallMd: Assuming the increase should also be 50%.
